intro: Benthamia graminea, commonly known as the slender benthamia, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Benthamia graminea is generally drought-tolerant and is often found in open grasslands and shrublands.
